replication_study.hypothesis: Among OECD countries, a one-year lagged increase in Imports from the South (share of GDP) is positively associated with National Affluence (GDP per capita).

data_plan.source_type: Combined OECD STAN macroeconomic series & UN COMTRADE trade flows, pre-compiled CSV
data_plan.sample_size: 784 country-year observations after lag-induced listwise deletion
data_plan.access_details: CSV already supplied in /app/data; public secondary data, no restriction.

qualification.explanation: Identical construction of key variables and countries as the original panel yet with 15 additional post-2003 years—an independent period to test robustness.
qualification.similarity_to_original: Same 18 OECD countries and variable formulas documented in post_registration.json and KMYR.do (e.g., Imports from South defined as totalimport/(gdp*10000)).
qualification.deviation_from_original: Original covered 1970-2003 (post_registration.json); supplied data span 1965-2018 (processed_data.csv inspection). Thus 2004-2018 provide new observations not in the original analysis.

data_plan.notes: GDP denominators in thousands → scaling factor 10000 mirrors Stata code; no missing after NA removal aside from first-lag rows.

planned_method.steps: 1) Load CSV; 2) Recreate variables (NAff, IMS, EXS, unemployment lag, time dummies) per KMYR.do; 3) Create 1-year lags; 4) Drop rows with missing lags; 5) Run PanelOLS with country fixed-effects and cluster-robust SE; 6) Save coefficient table.
planned_method.models: Country fixed-effects GLS (PanelOLS) with clustered SEs (equivalent to xtgls with panels(hetero) corr(psar1)).
planned_method.control_variables: Lagged Exports to South (EXS_lag1), lagged unemployment, five-year period dummies, country fixed effects.

planned_estimation_and_test.test: t-test of coefficient ≠ 0 with cluster-robust standard error.

planned_method.inference_criteria: Replicated effect considered successful if coefficient is positive and p < 0.05 (two-tailed).

files.replication_data/replicate_imports_afflu: Preprocesses finaldata_noNA.csv, builds variables/lags, fits PanelOLS FE model, prints and writes coefficient table to /app/data/replication_results.csv.

codebase.notes: Script keeps all I/O strictly within /app/data.  No other legacy Stata code executed.

analysis.comparison_metrics: Sign, statistical significance, and magnitude of IMS coefficient versus original (original b = 0.910, SE = 0.104).
